title: Dattatreya Temple, Gangapur
subtitle: A Sacred Abode of Lord Dattatreya on the Banks of Bhima River
overview: Dattatreya Temple in Gangapur, located near Gulbarga (Karnataka-Maharashtra border), is one of the most revered pilgrimage sites dedicated to Lord Dattatreya.
The temple marks the place where Sri Narasimha Saraswati — the second incarnation of Lord Dattatreya — lived and performed miracles during the 14th century.
Situated on the peaceful banks of the Bhima River, the temple exudes divine energy and attracts thousands of devotees annually, especially during Guru Pournima and Datta Jayanti.
Gangapur is part of the ‘Dattatreya Peethas’ and holds deep spiritual significance for followers of the Datta Sampradaya.

highlights.title: Spiritual Significance
highlights.description: Considered one of the most powerful Datta Peethas, where Lord Dattatreya manifested in human form as Shri Narasimha Saraswati.

highlights.title: Bhima-Amarja Sangam
highlights.description: A sacred confluence near the temple where devotees perform holy dips and rituals.

geography.intro: Gangapur is located near the Maharashtra–Karnataka border, on the serene banks of the Bhima River, surrounded by small hills and forests.

details.label: Temple Architecture
details.value: Dravidian with stone mandapa and shrines

climate.description: The area experiences tropical weather — warm summers and mild winters.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to February
Avoid peak monsoon due to possible river flooding.

geography.conclusion: With spiritual resonance and natural serenity, Gangapur is a divine retreat for seekers of peace and blessings.

activities.title: Darshan & Aarti
activities.description: Devotees attend daily Aartis and Abhishekam rituals performed at the main shrine.

activities.title: Holy Dip at Sangam
activities.description: The Bhima-Amarja Sangam is believed to cleanse sins and bring spiritual merit.
info: Special rituals during Pournima and Datta Jayanti.

activities.title: Reading Guru Charitra
activities.description: Devotees read or listen to the sacred Guru Charitra, recounting miracles of Narasimha Saraswati.
info: Temple trust provides seating and copies of the scripture.

attractions.title: Sangam of Bhima and Amarja Rivers
attractions.description: A serene confluence where devotees take holy dips and offer prayers.

attractions.title: Audumbar Tree
attractions.description: Believed to be the tree where Sri Narasimha Saraswati meditated and blessed devotees.

marineLife.intro: Though located inland, the temple’s proximity to the Bhima River sustains local aquatic life.

items.title: Freshwater Species
items.description: The river supports fish, turtles, and small crabs, enriching the natural setting.

items.title: River Ecosystem
items.description: Devotees are encouraged to keep the holy river clean during rituals.

conclusion: The flowing Bhima River enhances the divine aura of Gangapur.
Its sacred waters symbolize spiritual purification and peace.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Gangapur Road (22 km).
Regular trains available from Pune, Solapur, and Gulbarga.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Connected by road from Solapur (110 km) and Gulbarga (40 km).
Frequent buses and shared jeeps available to Gangapur.

gallery.alt: Main shrine of Lord Dattatreya at Gangapur

bookingTips.description: Temple dharmashalas and guesthouses are available nearby for pilgrims.
Carry extra water during summer visits; temperatures can be high.
Reading or listening to 'Guru Charitra' enhances the spiritual experience.
